sentences: The Secretariat introduced the issue ( FCCC/SBI/2006/MISC.7 and Add.1; FCCC/SBI/2006/MISC.11 and FCCC/SBI/2006/MISC.16 ).

The Philippines, for the G-77/CHINA, said the Fund's principles, governance structure and modalities should be agreed before deciding on institutional arrangements, and stressed that the Fund should be accountable to the COP/MOP.
Tuvalu, on behalf of AOSIS, welcomed discussion on the Fund's modalities and emphasized full cost funding for adaptation projects to assist the most vulnerable developing countries.
Bangladesh, for LDCs, said the Fund should be managed by an executive body such as the CDM Executive Board with regional representation, including LDCs.
JAPAN, NORWAY and SWITZERLAND said the GEF is best placed to manage the Fund.
The EU urged further consideration of the Fund's governance structure and early operationalization.
Chair Becker established a contact group co-chaired by Philip Gwage (Uganda) and Adrian Macey (New Zealand).
